Dear Mack McGhee:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer, at 517-899-6024.
Sincerely,
Vivian Malleck, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Title
Rule Code & R 400.4158 (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow
Section written policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
Description intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including but not
limited to: (iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth’s
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 02/28/2025 a staff member made a disparaging remark about
a youth's mother and threatened that other youth would assault
the youth if the youth did not "shut up."
Investigation Interviews
Left message for Complainant on 03/05/2025 and spoke with
Complainant on 03/10/2025. Complainant did not have additional
information.
Youth A was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
03/06/2025 with another Department of Health and Human
Service (DHHS) Worker. Youth A stated he was talking with Staff
1 and she said, “Your mom dumb like you” to him and told him
that he would get “jumped” if he did not stop talking.
Youth B was attempted to be interviewed at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention on 03/06/2025 in conjunction with another
DHHS Worker, but refused to be interviewed.
Youth C was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
03/13/2025 with another DHHS Worker. Youth C stated he did not
overhear Staff 1 and Youth A’s conversation when Youth A was in
his room.
Staff 1 was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
03/13/2025 with another DHHS Worker. Staff 1 stated Youth A
was angry and belligerent because his room was checked for
contraband items, which is done daily for his safety due to being
on one staff to one youth ratio as a self-harm precaution. Staff 1
stated Youth A said, “Your momma a dumbass” to her and she
2

replied, “No, your mom a dumbass.” Staff 1 stated she realized
she should not have made this comment.
Documentation
Wayne County Juvenile Detention’s Code of Ethic 3.1 policy and
procedure states in the section titled Staff/Youth Relationships
F. “Staff members shall not verbally abuse or humiliate youth.”
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance when Staff 1 called Youth
A’s mother a name.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 02/28/2025 the youth verbally retaliated back and another
youth body slammed the youth to the ground. The youth was hit in
the back of the head as a result and lost consciousness for three
minutes. The youth was hospitalized, diagnosed with concussion
and received sutures.
Investigation Interviews
Left message for Complainant on 03/05/2025 and spoke with
Complainant on 03/10/2025. Complainant did not have additional
information.
Youth A was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
03/06/2025 with another Department of Health and Human
Service (DHHS) Worker. Youth A stated he tried to argue back but
Staff 1 told him to be quiet after saying, “Your mom dumb like
you”. Youth A stated Youth B told him to stop talking to Staff 1
“like that” or they were “going to get into” when Youth A
threatened to “milk” (throw milk or juice) at her. Youth A stated
Staff 2 was his assigned staff for his one staff to one youth ratio
3

and Staff 2 did not redirect Youth B’s comment. Youth A stated he
exited his room and Youth B hit Youth A’s right eye, hit the back of
his head on the left side and “slams” Youth A to the ground. Youth
A stated Youth C pulled Youth B off him and either Staff 1 or Staff
2 called for assistance. Youth A stated he saw a nurse and was
sent to the hospital. Youth A stated he received two sutures above
his right eye and diagnosed with a mild concussion. Youth A was
observed with a healing cut above his right eyebrow. Youth A
stated the bump on the left side of his head is gone and he did not
have additional injuries from this incident. Youth A stated he has
not had further contact with Youth B because Youth B was
transferred to another unit.
Youth B stated he was not interested in being interviewed on
03/06/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile Detention with another
DHHS Worker. Prior to concluding his interview, Youth B stated
he has been on Unit 3A, Unit 3D and Unit 2D. Youth B stated he
currently resides on Unit 3C. Youth B described Staff 1 as nice,
caring and calm.
Youth C was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
03/13/2025 with another DHHS Worker. Youth C stated Youth A
was “running his mouth” and yelling about fighting when he was in
his room during shower time. Youth C stated he did not see how
the fight started but saw Youth B punch Youth A in the face and
then Youth A leaned over and covered his face with his arms.
Youth C stated Youth B then picked up Youth A from behind and
“slammed” him on to the ground. Youth C stated he reacted
immediately and grabbed Youth B by the shirt and pressed him
against the wall. Youth C stated he told Youth B about “right and
wrong” in reference to assaulting on Youth A. Youth C stated he
does not recall what Staff 1 or Staff 2 did in the incident because
he was focused on Youth B. Youth C then stated Staff 1 and Staff
2 were worried about Youth A’s bleeding injury. Youth C stated
Nurse and additional staff came to the unit to assist Youth A.
Staff 1 was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
03/13/2025 with another DHHS Worker. Staff 1 stated Youth A
was angry and belligerent because during shower time his
personal items were removed from his bedroom due to being on
one staff to one youth self-harm precaution. Staff 1 stated Youth A
yelled from his room but does not recall the specifics of what was
said. Staff 1 stated Youth A’s bedroom door was opened once he
calmed down. Staff 1 stated Youth B approached as Youth A
exited his room and hit Youth A and caused Youth A to go to the
ground. Staff 1 stated she called for supervisor assistance and
4

Staff 2 intervened and placed a towel under Youth A’s head to
catch the blood from the cut on his head. Staff 1 stated Supervisor
arrived and called for a nurse to evaluate Youth A. Staff 1 stated
she was suspended on 03/07/2025, 03/08/2025 and 03/09/2025
for name calling Youth A’s mother, not engaging in the incident
and the incorrect assistance call.
Staff 2 was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
03/13/2025 with another DHHS Worker. Staff 2 stated she was
assigned to Youth A as his one staff to one youth ratio for his self-
harming behaviors. Staff 2 stated she cleared out Youth A’s room
of personal items, such as, bar soap that Youth A eats or shreds
and sniffs and black tar pulled from the window sides of his room
door. Staff 2 stated Youth A was either in his room for reflection or
shower time yelling, “I’m rollin’ it. I’m on it. I’m beatin’ ass.” Staff 2
stated none of the youths responded to Youth A and she verbally
redirected Youth A and explained that no one was challenging or
offending him. Staff 2 stated when Staff 1 opened Youth A’s
bedroom door Youth B ran over and “1, 2, pick up and drop” Youth
A to the ground. Staff 2 stated Youth A bled from a cut on his
head and she placed a towel under his head. Staff 2 stated
Supervisor arrived and called the nurse. Staff 2 stated Youth C
asked Youth B how come he physically assaulted Youth A and
asked Youth A if he was alright. Staff 2 stated she was suspended
for three days for not engaging in the incident and the incorrect
assistance call.
Supervisor was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention
on 03/13/2025 with another DHHS Worker. Supervisor stated she
responded to a supervisor assistance call and saw Youth A laying
on the ground with a bleeding head injury. Supervisor stated she
called for a nurse because Staff 1 and Staff 2 called for supervisor
assistance and not for physical altercation assistance. Supervisor
stated nursing staff are required to report when it is a physical
altercation assistance call. Supervisor stated she reviewed the
video footage and suspended Staff 1 and Staff 2 for three days for
not engaging in the incident and the incorrect assistance call.
Nurse was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
03/13/2025 with another DHHS Worker. Nurse stated when she
arrived on Unit 2D she saw Youth A laying on the ground bleeding
from a cut above his right eyebrow area. Nurse stated she
cleaned the cut in the vestibule, sent a picture of the cut to the
doctor and told Youth A to keep pressure on the cut. Nurse stated
Youth A was sent out to the hospital for an evaluation. Nurse
5

stated she saw Youth A since his return and his sutured cut is
healing without issue.
Video
02/27/2025 video footage of Unit 2D room 11 area was reviewed.
Video does not record sound. Staff 2 is seated in a chair by Youth
A’s room door with the logbook. Staff 1 opens Youth A’s room
door and Youth A exits at or about 7:49:55 PM. Youth B looks at
Youth A and moves quickly to Youth A and then punches Youth A
multiple times. Youth A turns away from Youth B and covers his
head with his arms as he is punched. Youth B picks up Youth A
from behind and swings Youth A to the ground on his right side.
Youth C runs over and pushes Youth B away at or about 7:50:03
PM from Youth A, who is laying on the ground. During this time,
Staff 2 gets up from the chair and moves the chair out of the way.
Staff 1 and 2 move towards and check Youth A when he is on the
ground. Youth C then leans over and checks on Youth A and then
turns to Youth B, grabs the front of Youth B’s shirt, pushes Youth
B in the chest multiple times and moves Youth B away from Youth
A while yelling at Youth B. During this time, Youth A moves his
body and lifts his head while laying on the ground. Staff 2 places a
towel under Youth A’s head on or around 7:50:24. Blood stains
form on the towel.
Documentation
Staff 1 wrote an incident report dated 02/27/2025 at 7:40 PM. It
states Youth A and Youth B had a physical altercation over Youth
A’s words during shower time. Staff 1 wrote Youth A and Youth B
punched each other and staff intervened and tried to break up the
altercation. It states assistance was called and nurse evaluated
the youths.
02/27/2025 Nursing progress note states Supervisor called for an
evaluation of Youth A, who had a cut above his right eyebrow.
02/28/2025 Nursing progress note states Youth A was seen upon
his return from the hospital at 4:00 AM. It states Youth A received
two sutures to the cut above his right eyebrow.
Another DHHS Worker requested Youth A’s paperwork from the
hospital but it was not received for this incident.
Staff 1 was hired on 11/2024. Staff 1 completed Standard First Aid
training on 11/06/2024. Staff 1 completed Handle with Care
training (verbal de-escalation and physical management) on
11/11/2024 and 11/12/2024.
6

Staff 2 was hired on 01/2025. Staff 2 completed Standard First Aid
training on 01/15/2025. Staff 2 completed Handle with Care
training on 01/16/2025 and 01/17/2025.
Tour
Upon entering Unit 2D one steps into the common area. The unit
sink and counter are to the right and showers are to the left. 12
individual youth bedrooms surround the common area. The
common area is furnished with couches and tables with attached
stools.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance in providing for the needs,
protection and supervision of Youth A when Youth B assaulted
Youth A in the presence of Staff 1 and Staff 2 without immediate
intervention.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Review Standard First Aid procedures with Staff 1 and Staff 2.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Title
Rule Code & R 400.4158 (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow
Section written policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
Description intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including but not limited to:
(v) Peer on peer discipline.
Violation Additional Finding
Type
Investigation Interviews
Youth A was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
03/06/2025 with another Department of Health and Human
Service (DHHS) Worker. Youth A stated Youth C pulled Youth B
off of him.
Youth B refused to be interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention on 03/06/2025 with another DHHS Worker.
7

Youth C was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
03/13/2025 with another DHHS Worker. Youth C stated he
reacted immediately when Youth B assaulted Youth A. Youth C
stated he grabbed Youth B by the shirt and pressed him against
the wall. Youth C stated Staff 1 and Staff 2 did not redirect him
when he intervened with Youth B.
Video
02/27/2025 video footage of Unit 2D room 11 area was reviewed.
Video does not record sound. Video shows Youth C pushes Youth
B away from Youth A and Youth C grabs Youth B’s shirt and
pushes Youth B multiple times while yelling at Youth B.
Documentation
Wayne County Juvenile Detention’s Physical Management 10.1
policy and procedure states in the section titled Prohibited
Interventions (g) “Peer-on-peer discipline or utilizing the
assistance of another youth to implement a restraint.”
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance when Youth C intervened
and physically moved Youth B away from Youth A.
CONSULTATION
Youth C’s demonstration of empathy and willingness to intervene
on behalf of Youth A shows strength on his part. However, it is the
staff’s responsibility to intervene in physical altercations. Youth B
could have retaliated against Youth C’s actions and escalated the
situation to a physical altercation between Youth B and Youth C.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Rule Code Seclusion within secure and nonsecure facilities; seclusion
Title plan; prohibitions; reduction and elimination.
Rule Code & R 400.4162 Seclusion within secure and nonsecure facilities;
Section seclusion plan; prohibitions; reduction and elimination.
Description (5) Staff may not use seclusion for discipline, punishment,
administrative convenience, retaliation, staffing shortages, or
reasons other than a temporary response to behavior that
threatens immediate harm to a youth or others.
Violation Additional Finding
Type
8

Investigation Interviews
Youth C was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
03/13/2025 with another DHHS Worker. Youth C stated Unit 2D
youths are locked in their rooms during shower time.
Staff 1 was interviewed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
03/13/2025 with another DHHS Worker. Staff 1 stated youths are
placed in their rooms with the door closed and locked during
showers for approximately 60 minutes.
Documentation
Wayne County Juvenile Detention Unit 2D weekday daily
schedule states shower time and evening checkout is from 6:00
PM to 7:00 PM.
Wayne County Juvenile Detention requested a variance to use
seclusion only when a youth becomes an imminent danger to self
or others and de-escalation techniques have failed. This variance
was approved by Division of Child Welfare Licensing Director. The
initial seclusion variance was requested on 08/26/2024 and
approved with a 10/26/2024 expiration date. A second seclusion
variance was requested on 10/23/2024 and approved with a
12/23/2024 expiration date. A third seclusion variance was
requested on 12/20/2024 and approved with a 02/20/2025
expiration date. A fourth seclusion variance was requested on
02/21/2025 and approved with a 04/21/2025 expiration date.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance for secluding Unit 2D
youths in their rooms during shower time. This is outside the
parameters of their approved variance.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Youths may remain in their rooms with their doors open or
unlocked during shower time.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
2025SIC0000354 – Corrective Action Plan pending
9

IV. RECOMMENDATION
As a result of the findings in this investigation, a corrective action plan is required.
